  â  
'''Self-immolation''' refers to setting oneself on [[fire]], often as a form of protest or for the purposes of [[martyrdom]] or [[suicide]]. It has centuries-long traditions in some cultures, while in modern times it has become a type of radical political protest. Michael Biggs compiled a list of 533 self-immolations reported in western media from the 1960s to 2002.<ref name=biggs/>
